acknowledgments.summary: Joseph Bingham of Tenable reported this vulnerability to Siemens.

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an execution of some commands without proper authentication.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Chemical, Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Food and Agriculture, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and 
solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT:

https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and  solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target this vulnerability. This vulnerability is not exploitable remotely.
notes.title: Exploitability

references.summary: SSA-496604: SSA-721298: Missing Authentication Vulnerability in TIA Administrator (TIA Portal) - TXT Version

product.name: TIA Administrator: All versions < V1.0 SP1 Upd1

notes.text: The integrated configuration web application (TIA Administrator) allows to execute certain application commands without proper authentication.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text: The vulnerability could be exploited by an attacker with local access to the affected system. Successful exploitation requires no privileges and no user interaction. An attacker could use the vulnerability to compromise confidentiality and integrity and availability of the affected system.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text: At the time of advisory publication no public exploitation of this security vulnerability was known.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Restrict access to port 8888/tcp to localhost (default)
Update to V1.0 SP1 Upd1 - Download: https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/114358

As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemensâ€™ operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals. Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
